io.janusproject.kernel.services.jdk.network

Class NoNetworkService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractService
      • io.janusproject.services.network.AbstractNetworkingService
        • io.janusproject.kernel.services.jdk.network.NoNetworkService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Service, DependentService, NetworkService

    public class NoNetworkService
extends AbstractNetworkingService
    Service that is providing the network service but does not send othet the network.

    2.0.1.0 2014-10-16 21:50:58

    Stéphane Galland

      • connectToRemoteSpaces

        public void connectToRemoteSpaces(URI peerUri,
                         SpaceID space,
                         NetworkService.NetworkEventReceivingListener listener)
                           throws Exception
        Connect this instance of kernel to the given peer over the network and for the given space.

        If the network service is not yet ready for connecting the given URI, this URI MUST be bufferized until the network service has been fully started.

        Parameters:
        peerUri - - the URI of the remote kernel to be connected to.
        space - - the identifier of the space to be connected to.
        listener - - listener on the receiving of the events.
        Throws:
        Exception - - when the peer cannot be connected.

      • disconnectFromRemoteSpace

        public void disconnectFromRemoteSpace(URI peer,
                             SpaceID space)
                               throws Exception
        Disconnect this peer from the given peer for the given space.
        Parameters:
        peer - - the URI of the remote kernel to be disconnected from.
        space - - the identifier of the space to be disconnected from.
        Throws:
        Exception - - when the peer cannot be disconnected.

      • disconnectPeer

        public void disconnectPeer(URI peer)
                    throws Exception
        Disconnect this peer from the given peer for all the spaces.
        Parameters:
        peer - - the URI of the remote kernel to be disconnected from.
        Throws:
        Exception - - when the peer cannot be disconnected.

      • getServiceDependencies

        public Collection<Class<? extends Service>> getServiceDependencies()
        Replies the services that must be launched BEFORE launching this service, and that must be stop AFTER stopping this service.

        If one of the dependencies is a AsyncStateService, this service will way until AsyncStateService.isReadyForOtherServices() is true.

        Returns:
        the dependencies.
        See Also:
        DependentService.getServiceWeakDependencies()

      • getServiceWeakDependencies

        public Collection<Class<? extends Service>> getServiceWeakDependencies()
        Replies the services that must be launched BEFORE launching this service, and that must be stop AFTER stopping this service.

        Even if one of the dependencies is a AsyncStateService, this service will never wait until AsyncStateService.isReadyForOtherServices() is true.

        Returns:
        the dependencies.
        See Also:
        DependentService.getServiceDependencies()
